content: This would be a 5-star app if it wasn't for hazard perception. I have a full UK motorbike licence and have been on the road for 5 years. we are told to spot a hazard as soon as possible. yet on this app and the test we get no marks for clicking "early" yet it isn't early if I spotted it. this is an absolute joke of a way to test this. if I have spotted and recognised the hazard 1 millisecond before you say it's there I get 0 points even though it's on screen.
replyContent:
Hello Clayton. Thank you for your feedback. I'm sorry to hear that you were not happy with the product. When taking the hazard perception test you will be required to click only at the point you would need to change direction or slow down for a hazard.  When approached with this in mind you will find the clips much more useful. 

Best Wishes.

content: I have passed the test at the first attempt scoring 50 out of 50. Questions are very similar to the practice questions from this app. But only thing I would like to mention that there are insufficient number of hazard perception test clips on this app which I think is inadequate.
replyContent:
Hi Nilanjan. Thank you for your feedback. We were only able to fit a finite amount of clips on this app due to size concerns. The clips are very large files and with more of the added the app would have taken up much more storage space. We now produce a separate Hazard Perception app with 14 unique clips to counter this issue. 

Regards. 

TSO

replyContent:
Hi,

The app was updated with new study detail and practice/mock test questions to reflect changes to Highway Code rules (learners driving on motorways during lessons) and to MOT and first aid info. Due to the scale of changes, we weren‚Äôt able to update the app without losing users‚Äô progress.

Apologies for any inconvenience or frustration caused.

content: This was my only study material for the test and it helped me pass the it. I suggest completing all the study sections questions and mock tests provided in this app.
Thanks to this app i passed my theory test

If you want to do tests which mimick the exam do NOT use this app. They do not use case study questions in the mock tests and do not have any way of simulating doing 14 hazard tests in one go - in fact they expect you to learn from repeating the same clips even though I could tell you what was going to happen in them. The bank of questions on the mock test also does not reflect how many they have in the actual test meaning you could get asked questions you've never done before. DO NOT RECOMMEND .
replyContent:
Hi,

The clips are designed to help you prepare for the types of hazard you will face in the test, it‚Äôs not a mock test. The app is a learning tool to help you understand the theory behind the questions, there‚Äôs over 750 questions which cover all the topics you will face in the real test. No learning tool will contain questions from a real exam.

content: Great app! Passed my theory test today. Thank you.
Very useful app I like it

Honestly this was one of the best techniques I used to study for my driving theory test. Every 'study' section is thorough and gives you an option to refer to a specific section in the Highway Code should you need further explanation about any point. The practice questions at the end of each section are perfect for reinforcing the information you have just read. Every question on my test was one I had done previously on the app. The hazard perception section is also useful, despite requiring more space to download the clips. It simulates the real conditions of the test. I would highly recommend this.
Just passed my test thanks to this app. Has everything you need in order to get you ready for your test. Definitely worth having if you're learning to drive.

content: brilliant app

Does the job but needs a lot of work (especially given its price tag).  This app is an obvious iOS port and the UI needs to be updated to bring it into line with other android apps. The way that the videos are downloaded is amateurish and the downloads cannot run in the background or be paused. Some of the assets (pictures and videos) look bad on high resolution displays and so they need to be updated.
replyContent:
Hello Mr Ranson

Thanks for your feedback. We have taken it on board.

Regarding resolution, we can comment that the theory test question images are from the official DVSA revision bank and are like those you‚Äôll see in the real test. Our DVSA apps have helped thousands to pass their theory tests. 

Good luck with your test!

Kind Regards

Rob

content: Passed first time.  Thanks for the app.

I downloaded the app and bought the theory books and  highway code but think the app is just as good on its own. Although there isn't as many hazard perception clips, I think it does prepare you for what happens in the actual test. I passed today!

This app is brilliant. I passed both theory and hazard and for this I'm very grateful..      My only issue (slight glitch) was , when reviewing incorrect answers...    if I clicked on "explain" sometimes it would suggest you look in highway code for more details ..   after I'd clicked the suggested page and got more info I would lose the review page and couldn't continue learning from my mistakes once I'd click back to exit the highway code.   Despite that... it's still a 5 stars because I used this app and passed 1st time.

Disappointing: 1) the hazard videos are over 300mb for a few minutes of content. 300mb can store about an hour of data compressed video (BBC iplayer?). Please employ some data compression technology. The download server for these videos is sketchy, as reflected in other reviews.  2) I chose to practice "unanswered questions" and repeatedly was presented with questions i had already been asked.   Not happy, expected more from the OFFICIAL APP for ¬£4.99
replyContent:
Hi Charles

Thanks for your feedback. 
1) we‚Äôre looking at reducing the size of the app and expect an update in the near future
2) the app contains the official DVSA revision bank some of which are similar. This is to help you really learn the theory thoroughly.  

Good luck with your revision and test! 

Rob

content: I passed my test yesterday and got 50/50 for the multiple choice questions and 65/75 for the hazard perception. It is essential you study your highway code thoroughly if you wanna answer those never seen questions correctly. Do not neglect the case studies and read carefully through the scenarios.  Although this app already contains the highway code I would recommend to buy the book version of it. The hazard perception part isn't great but if you have had enough driving lessons your instructor would have taught you what to look out for.  Download it and revise from the highway code and you will pass.

content: Why is there only 10 clips on the hazard perception it's a good app but
replyContent:
Hi Jade,

The reason for the presence of only 10 clips at the moment is due to the size of the files. They're of a high picture quality and would take up a lot of storage on devices if more clips were added. 

They're intended to be representative of the appearance of the actual test, and will teach you what you need to know to recognise a hazard.
